question: What is the time taken by the rashes to appear on the body of the patient after the Measles attack?
explanation: Measles is a very infectious and potentially serious illness that is caused by a type of virus called paramyxovirus. It is spread from person to person by coughing, sneezing or sometimes kissing. Symptoms will usually begin to show 10 to 14 days after infection with the measles virus. A person with measles is infectious for 2-4 days before the rash appears (when there may be symptoms of fever and tiredness), and for up to 4 days after the rash has appeared.
